case.name: Norm Engineering v Digga Australia (No. 3) [2007] FCA 953 (26 June 2007)

citphrases.citphrase: consideration of the final form of orders to be made arising out of the judgment in norm engineering v digga australia [2007] fca 761.
consideration of a claim of infringement of copyright in drawings for the components of an assembled industrial bucket used with 'bobcat' equipment

consideration of originality and authorship, subsistence of copyright, use by a respondent of a three-dimensional article to indirectly produce drawings relied upon in manufacturing three-dimensional articles
consideration of reproduction of the work by application of a corresponding design to articles (pre-17 june 2004 position)
consideration of embodiment of a corresponding design in a product (post-17 june 2004 position)

consideration of damages pursuant to s 115(2) of the copyright act 1968 (cth) and s 115(4) of that act copyright act 1968 (cth), ss 10(1) , 13 , 14 (1), 21 (3), 31 (1)(b), 32 , 35(6), 36(1), 74-77, 77a, 115(2), 115(4)
consideration of scope of discovery concerning documents going to access and use of the applicant's article by a respondent for the purposes of copyright proceedings.
failure to provide the report of an expert in accordance with the directions orders
application to adjourn the trial on grounds of prejudice in the conduct of the trial.

legistitles.title: COPYRIGHT ACT 1968
COPYRIGHT ACT 1968 - SECT 4 Extension to external Territories
COPYRIGHT ACT 1968 - SECT 74 Corresponding design
COPYRIGHT ACT 1968 - SECT 77 Application of artistic works as industrial designs without registration of the designs
COPYRIGHT ACT 1968 - SECT 115 Actions for infringement
FEDERAL COURT RULES
